results.title: Disease Management Product Manager
results.description:
About BrightInsight:

With over 400M connected medical devices worldwide and the value of the healthcare Internet of Things (IoT) market valued at $163 billion, it’s no surprise that venture funding in the Digital Health space has hit record highs year after year. What’s clear is that all of healthcare’s future products – medical devices, combination products, wearables, Software as Medical Device and more – will all be digitally driven. A leader in the digital health space is BrightInsight, the VC-backed Silicon Valley startup that provides the leading global regulated IoT platform for the world’s top biopharma and medtech companies.

Since launching the BrightInsight Platform in 2018, we have secured a number of top-tier customers, including six of the world’s top 10 biopharma companies and three leading diagnostic companies. Our platform has been honored with some 15 industry awards, including CB Insights Digital Health 150 in 2020 and 2021, Google Partner of the Year, Healthcare and Life Sciences for two consecutive years, and BrightInsight ranked 13 on the LinkedIn Top Startups List in the U.S.

We are a team of experienced professionals who have first-hand experience building and scaling digital health solutions within the regulated healthcare space. We are passionate about what we do and wholeheartedly believe in our vision to transform patient outcomes globally by bringing the power of digital technology to healthcare.

If you enjoy working with solution-oriented, driven colleagues in an agile, bureaucratic-free environment, then come join us at BrightInsight.

About the Role:

The Product Manager will be located remote in the US. The BrightInsight platform is a cloud-based medical IoT platform for the life sciences industry, and is used to manage, process, and store patient health and medical device data to be used for patient diagnosis and treatment.

As Product Manager, you are responsible for the success of launching and managing a product portfolio built on the BrightInsight Platform. BrightInsight portfolio products including pharmaceutical or disease management specific solutions, indication-specific therapies, and capabilities for business users, providers, and patients.

You will work closely with customers, fellow Product Managers, Designers, Engineering, Sales, Marketing, Regulatory, Quality, Legal and other internal stakeholders to define, design, develop, and manage one or more products.

Above all, you will have an opportunity to help the healthcare industry leverage digital technology to engage patients, improve outcomes, and save lives. 

 We are looking for someone who demonstrates:

  • Disease management and/or pharmaceutical background
  • Past experience delivering/launching one or more products into the life-science market
  • Intense collaboration
  • Passionate customer focus
  • Fast learner
  • Thoughtful, fast, disciplined execution 

Here’s a glimpse of what you’ll do:

  • A true leader in global pharmaceutical who can drive product strategy, internal investment models, defining and building a market and successfully launching products. 
  • Conduct needs analysis and business case development process for product solutions, and develop and maintain short and long product roadmaps as part of the PDLC process.
  • Drive innovation of product creation, enhancement, and cross-functionalization. The candidate will facilitate ideation with business partners, combine ideas to create a multiplying effect, and conduct rapid prototyping sessions to assess viability.
  • Optimizing the intersection of product, engineering, professional services, sales, and customer success. Improve alignment, communications, and processes around building the products.
  • Externally-facing responsibilities related to driving customer adoption, external communication, etc.
  • Lead agile product delivery including backlog management, economic prioritization, iteration planning, and communications with business stakeholders.
  • Communicate with business on progress, manage escalations, and address customer issues to maintain high customer engagement and satisfaction with solutions developed.
  • Be a consultative partner that expertly balances business and technical competence to help inform and influence problem-solving, and establish a successful path forward.

Here’s some of what you’ll need (required):

  • BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Analytics, Applied Mathematics, Decision Science, or Business Administration
  • 10 years of experience, with at least 5 years leading software product teams, ideally software platform products,  in a matrix environment
  • 7+ years of software product management experience managing successful product definition, market analysis, prototyping, launch, go-to-market strategy, and post-launch roadmap
  • Proven success of bringing new B2B software products to market, ideally into a new category, gaining rapid adoption by intended customers
  • Experience with communicating technical product strategies with executive management
  • Experience working with technical cross-functional teams (e.g., engineering, commercial/sales, UI/UX, Program Management, etc.) and cross-organization teams
  • Experience working independently on technical product strategy which is not fully defined and managing complex product management scenarios
  • MBA, Six Sigma certification
  • Experience bringing new software products to market
  • 5+ years of disease management or pharmaceutical background

What We Value:

At our core, we value partnership. We are strategic partners to our customers, and we partner together every day to achieve our vision of transforming patient outcomes globally by bringing the power of digital technology to healthcare.

  • Passion about transforming care and patient outcomes
  • Accountability to one another, our valued customers and our mission-critical projects
  • Respect for one another, our customers and the data that we manage
  • Trust in each other and display integrity in everything we do
  • Nimble and agile in our work, but without short cuts
  • Excellence in the products we deliver and people we hire
  • Real world impact – we aim to positively impact healthcare globally by executing every day on our mission of accelerating digital health innovation for our biopharma and MedTech customers

What You’ll Love About Us:

  • Competitive salary and quarterly bonus plan
  • Equity in the company
  • Full range of medical, dental, vision benefits
  • Supplemental maternity/paternity time off policy
  • 401K match
  • Life insurance/AD&D/STD/LTD
  • Unaccrued paid time off (US)
  • Paid Monthly Mental Health Days Off

BrightInsight is an Equal Opportunity Employer and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. BrightInsight does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of: age, race, religious belief, colour, sex, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, pregnancy status or any other status protected by law. BrightInsight makes reasonable adjustments so that qualified applicants with a disability may participate in the selection process. BrightInsight will contact you if it is determined that your background is a match to the required skills required for this position. Thank you for considering a career with BrightInsight.

results.title: Technology Product Manager
results.description:
Who We Are:

Reformation is a fast-growing, mission-based company that proves fast fashion and sustainability can coexist. With both our HQ and our own factory based in Los Angeles, we combine stylish, vintage-inspired designs with sustainable practices. We release limited-edition collections every week on our website and in our 20+ brick and mortar stores.

We are a future focused organization committed to the belief that the problems facing our planet and society can be solved through innovation, common sense and education. Being naked is the #1 most sustainable option. We're #2.

Here at Ref, we put people first. We know that you can't innovate and do cool stuff without having everyone on board. So we work to create a culture where everyone feels like they belong and where their voices are truly valued. We build an inclusive culture together, and make areal impact along the way.

 

Technology Product Manager:

We are looking for an experienced Technology Product Manager to drive product roadmaps and execution of next generation operational systems and tools at Reformation. In this highly impactful role, you will holistically own and lead at least one of the operational areas such as planning, supply chain, fulfillment, delivery etc. As part of ownership, you will build a deep understanding of our operational challenges and break down complex problems, inject innovation in our technology systems, and create best in class capabilities for stakeholders ranging from internal users, vendors and/or delight end-user experiences. In addition, you will execute the full lifecycle of shipping new features and other product initiatives. This includes partnering with operations to understand requirements, with business owners to define success metrics, with engineering to create and implement product roadmap and with several other internal/external stakeholders to execute product launch plans. 

 

What You’ll Do:

Product Management:

  • Be the Technical Product Management lead for one or several operational systems
  • Drive the development of the Reformation Operations technology roadmap with focus on scalability, cost and service optimization 
  • Collaborate with Supply Chain, Fulfillment, Inventory,  Planning, Production and Finance on business objectives and requirements and translate them into product roadmaps, features and timelines.
  • Ensure technology products and systems are of the highest quality and delivered on time to meet business objectives.
  • Work across the organization to develop novel solutions for complex problems.

Leadership, Culture and Team:

  • Develop working relationships with other functions to create transparency into tech roadmap development
  • Partner closely with engineering, operations and other stakeholders to land the best in class products for our internal/external customers and/or delightful experiences for end-users
  • Create a culture of tech enablement across Reformation

What You’ll Need: 

  • Bachelor's degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience
  • 5 years of product management or related experience
  • Experience building and shipping technical products
  • Experience driving product strategy and design discussions
  • Experience working with and influencing multiple cross functional teams without direct authority
  • Experience with operations systems and technology - planning, supply chain, fulfillment
  • ML and new tech trends knowledge

Who You Are:

  • Strong cross functional collaborator
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and love of developing products from an early stage
  • Experience working in a high growth environment, with constantly shifting priorities; ability to create order out of chaos.
  • More apt to saying “yes” or “we’ll try” (rather than “no” or “that’s impossible”). 
  • Acts with a sense of urgency.
  • Someone who leads by example.

 

Benefits & Perks:

  • Health, vision, and dental insurance for eligible employees
  • Paid vacation, sick, holidays & volunteer time-off for eligible employees
  • Mission based company + casual and entrepreneurial work environment
  • Clothing discount, great teams, VTO, and more!
  • 401K with company match 

 

Salary Range: $100k - $200k DOE

 

To Apply:

Please submit your resume and a short cover letter telling us about yourself and why you are a great fit for Reformation!

Reformation requires all employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to starting work.  Reformation is an equal opportunity employer, and will consider requests for exemption from this policy as a reasonable accommodation where it can do so absent undue hardship, consistent with federal, state, and local law.

The Reformation is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status

results.title: Senior Marketing Operations Manager
results.description:
From product marketing to sales enablement to customer success to finance - and more, we’re home to 14 (at the time of writing!) thriving communities that collectively unite 100,000+ professionals worldwide. Organisations partner with us to reach our niche engaged communities through branding, thought leadership, and lead generation programs.

 

We’re a fast-growing and moving org and we need an experienced MarOps whizz to help us ensure we’re operating efficiently, leveraging automations, have accurate + easy-to-access reporting & dashboards at our fingertips - and more.

 

Reporting to the CMO, you’ll:

 

  • Own the end-to-end build and maintenance of the entire marketing department’s reporting and dashboards using platforms like Salesforce, Google Data Studio, Geckoboard, and more.

  • Work with the various marketing pillars to identify opportunities in our journeys based on data and disseminate insights and actions to implement.

  • Be a key cog in the marketing and sales relationship and ensure our campaigns, processes, and tracking are seamlessly integrated and optimized.

  • Work with the wider RevOps team to ensure our CRM captures the information we need to report on marketing effectiveness and roll out iterations to constantly enhance our activities.

  • Help define high-performing lead scoring criteria for our various revenue streams so we can capture and fill quality pipelines per product.

  • Lead on marketing attribution best practice across departments to support marketing spend on the right channels.

  • Lead on processes automation, making sure we operate at maximum efficiency, delivering the right messages, at the right prospects, at the right time.

  • Co-ordinate marketing launches to ensure all departments are aligned, on track, and set-up for success.

  • Line management responsibility of our Data Operations Exec to ensure all new data is nurtured effectively and that our campaigns are continually optimized.

  • Support with the integration of new tools and tech as and when required and ensure they are correctly implemented and adopted.

  • Own the week-to-week maintenance of Segment (our CDP) as well as any integrations and new audience requests as required.

  • Vet new tools and tech as required to ensure they’re fit for purpose, integrate with the rest of our stack, and help us achieve our goals - as well as proactively spotting gaps in our existing tech stack.

 

Requirements:

 

  • 2-3 years experience in a MarOps role.

  • Experience using Segment, Salesforce, Zapier, GDS and GA4.

  • You’re a natural and proactive problem-solver with a process-driven mindset.

  • You’ve got great communication skills with key stakeholders across departments.

  • You are naturally self-directed, operate at a high cadence, and get stuff done with minimum supervision.

  • You're passionate about using and understanding the data behind WHY things happen and use this to shape your campaigns.

  • You expertly balance and prioritize your daily to-do's, as well as your short-term and long-term planning.

  • You are an extraordinary teammate always willing to jump in and offer support and say "yes" to taking on new things.

  • Confidence to experiment with different tactics, shake up strategy, adapt to new trends, to incorporate business changes, or to bounce back from subpar results.

  • You thrive in a fast-paced start-up, target -driven environment.

Benefits:

Competitive Salary

 

Enhanced paid holiday: 

  • 34 days including UK Bank holidays and a day off on your birthday

Private Medical & Dental

 Life Insurance: (4 x salary)

 

Wellbeing:

  • On-demand therapy, coaching & mental fitness via Oliva

  • Heavily subsidised gym membership via Gympass

  • Cycle to work & Workplace Nursery schemes

  • Early bird or night owl? Our flexible hours policy allows you to structure your work for when your most productive

     

Flexible benefits via the thanksBen platform:

  • £600 annually in year 1 scaling to over £1,980+ annually based on the length of service

     

Learning & Development:

  • Personal L&D budget £500 annually in year 1 scaling to £3000+ annually based on length of service

 

Volunteer & L&D Days:

  • We offer 1 additional paid day per quarter for you to dedicate to either L&D or Charity/ Volunteer activities

     

New tech gear: 

  • Laptop, screen, mouse, keyboard. We got you covered.

     

Company social events

results.title: Associate Director, Marketing
results.description:
About TKS:

The Knowledge Society (TKS) is a global human accelerator focused on developing young people (ages 13-18) to impact billions. In TKS, students learn about solving problems using emerging technologies, develop foundational mindsets, and build real-world skills, while being part of a global community of like-minded people.

Our vision is to help create the next generation of unicorn people - people who impact billions. In 2020, TKS was recognized by The World Economic Forum as a "School of the Future" and was also featured in Forbes, BBC, Fast Company etc..

We currently have 2,500+ students and alumni from over 200 cities globally. Our alumni have started venture-backed companies, performed cutting-edge research, presented at the world's largest conferences, and are creating solutions to tackle important problems like maternal mortality, disease, and energy.

 

As our Associate Director, Marketing at TKS:

  • You’re not marketing the next fad, eCommerce solution, or marketplace app - you'll be helping future leaders access world-class coaching and mentoring, impacting the course of young people's lives, and making positive change.

  • With your help, we will be able to change the education industry for the better by creating global awareness about TKS' mission, vision, and program delivery model — helping us communicate our 'school of the future' model to new global audiences and convert prospects into students. Ultimately the goal here is to popularize that new Education models exists and work.

  • You’ll be getting in on the ground-level. With big expansion plans for 2023 and beyond, we're gaining momentum. Despite our huge impact to-date, we're still a lean team - join us as we begin to scale on our journey to become the leader in education. Your role will grow as TKS expands.

 

How You’ll Add Value:

  • Generate 6,000 submitted applications for our virtual program next year

  • Generate 400 submitted applications per city in five different cities

  • Transform TKS into a world-class brand that attracts the most ambitious students from around the world

More specifically, your performance will be measured on three areas:

1 - Applications and Growth,

2- Brand Growth,

3- Team/resource management

Applications and Growth

  • Setting growth goals and strategies in each market, setting and tracking KPIs for each individual team member and channel

  • Ensure we’re adhering to target CAC and CPL

  • Project manage/oversee each team member's responsibilities for lead and application generation in areas like schools and youth organizations, events, social media marketing, SEO, and conversion optimization.

  • Own all paid initiatives, including ads on Tiktok, Google ecosystem, Instagram, Snapchat, affiliate marketing, paid newsletters and sponsorship

  • Set up dashboards and tracking for applications and paid initiatives

Brand

  • Help TKS get recognized by global influencers and outlets

  • Overview of content strategy and review all content produced by communications specialist and - approving content and messaging, helping optimize content to focus on based on data and metrics

  • Key channels: Organic social - Instagram, Youtube (and Shorts), Tiktok, LinkedIn, Twitter, newsletter/discord server

  • Ensure the marketing team is adhering to brand guidelines and voice

  • Scheduling video/photo capture opportunities, creative briefs and managing contractors as needed for brand assets

Team Management

  • Owning all budgeting, reporting and team management

  • Project management of all team tasks on Asana, Google Suite, etc…

  • Ensuring communications between the program, operations, partnerships and marketing teams are smooth

  • Understanding team hiring needs and assisting with the recruitment and hiring/onboarding and platform access process

 

What we’re looking for:

  • You have experience managing 6- to 7-figure budgets — and more importantly, you can speak to results, efficiencies, and mistakes you’ve learned from.

  • You have experience leading teams (our Marketing team is likely to grow to 5-8+ next year). You’ve been a player/coach before — you can jump in where needed to ensure stuff gets done and nothing gets dropped.

  • Background in a marketing related field. Experience with performance marketing and/or growth marketing preferred. ROAS and CAC are part of your regular vocabulary — better yet, your performance has been evaluated on these KPIs in past roles.

  • You follow marketing trends and regularly get jazzed about new ideas and techniques. You regularly conduct small experiments to validate ideas, you see this as one of your favourite parts of the job.

  • You have a deep passion for changing the education system: You have your own reasons for creating this change, and the ambition to want to scale it.

  • You’re obsessed with storytelling: You understand how powerful narratives are to change human behavior.

  • You have high standards: We're building a world-class brand and cannot settle for mediocrity especially when we share things that are public facing.

 

Benefits/Perks

  • Build relationships with the next generation of unicorn founders

  • Competitive compensation

  • Complete ownership and autonomy

  • Network with influential people

  • Work with smart people who enjoy high-quality conversations

  • Access to TKS program content – always be learning 💡

 

Three reasons why people join the TKS team:

  1. The fulfillment and joy of helping ambitious young people discover their passion, achieve their potential, and make lifelong friendships. We have a meaningful impact on peoples' lives who will shape the future.

  2. Work with awesome mission-driven people who want to make the world a better place. The people at TKS are kind, intelligent, fun, and authentic. There's no politics here.

  3. Have flexibility and ownership over your time. We value results, which is directly correlated with the growth of the students and their enjoyment in the program.

Ps. Yes, we offer health benefits, vacation, swag, and other nice perks.

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
Position Objectives
  • Drive the product- and business-planning processes for cross-functional teams for assigned product features and functions.
  • Analyze customer needs, current market trends, and potential partnerships from an ROI and build-vs.-buy perspective
  • Assess current competitor offerings and seek opportunities for differentiation
  • Analyze product requirements and develop appropriate programs and project milestones to ensure they’re met
  • Develop, implement, and maintain product delivery timelines across multiple departments
  • Appraise new product ideas and strategize and deliver on appropriate go-to-market launch activities
 
Responsibilities
  • Drive the execution of all processes in the product lifecycle, including product and market research, competitor analysis, planning, positioning, requirements (feature overview and user stories), roadmap development, and pre and post product launch
  • Translate product strategy into detailed requirements (feature overview and user stories) for prototyping and final development
  • Create product strategy documents that describe business cases, high-level use cases, technical requirements, revenue, and ROI
  • Collaborate closely with engineering, production, marketing, support, and sales teams in the development, QA, and release of products, and balance resources to ensure success for the entire organization
 
Competencies and Experience
  • Strong experience in a dynamic product management role in an agile development environment.
  • Previous experience in software and web development
  • Proven success in overseeing all elements of the software development lifecycle
  • High effectiveness in managing cross-functional teams
  • Experience in delivering finely tuned product features and requirements
  • Exceptional writing and editing skills, combined with strong presentation and public speaking skills
 
Preferred skills and qualifications
  • Previous experience with SMS/Text Servicing
  • Previous experience with Payment Services

 

Featured Benefits

Employer-provided

  • Medical insurance
  • Vision insurance
  • Dental insurance
  • 401(k)

 

Game-changing Technology Built for Growth

Solutions By Text (SBT) has changed the way compliant businesses communicate and transact with their customers via mobile devices. Since adding its first client, SBT has quickly become the leading text provider to consumer finance companies and various other regulated industries. Recognized as  an  Inc  5000  fastest  growing  companies, SBT continues to grow and expand through the addition of great employees who desire a growth culture.

 

About Solutions by Text

Solutions by Text (SBT) was founded in 2008 with the mission to deliver impactful conversational messaging and convenient payment partner solutions that are rich, real-time and compliant. Built on SMS industry best practices, the company is the only compliance-first provider of enterprise texting solutions in the market. More than 1400 consumer finance organizations, including leading brands in auto finance, banking and lending, trust SBT to ensure convenient, effective and compliant relationships with their millions of consumers. SBT is headquartered in Dallas, TX with remote teams and offices around the US and in Bangalore, India. For more information, visit https://solutionsbytext.com/.

 

Solutions By Text is committed to promoting the values of diversity and inclusion throughout the business.  Whether it is through recruitment, retention, career progression or training and development, we are committed to improving opportunities for people regardless of their background or circumstances.

results.title: Product Manager, Financial Systems
results.description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW

Recently named one of Entrepreneur magazine’s Top 100 Cannabis Leaders, Cresco Labs is one of the largest vertically-integrated multi-state cannabis operators in the United States. Cresco is built to become the most important company in the cannabis industry by combining the most strategic geographic footprint with one of the leading distribution platforms in North America. Employing a consumer-packaged goods (“CPG”) approach to cannabis, Cresco’s house of brands is designed to meet the needs of all consumer segments and includes some of the most recognized and trusted national brands including Cresco, Remedi and Mindy’s, a line of edibles created by James Beard Award-winning chef Mindy Segal. Sunnyside*, Cresco’s national dispensary brand is a wellness-focused retailer designed to build trust, education and convenience for both existing and new cannabis consumers. Recognizing that the cannabis industry is poised to become one of the leading job creators in the country, Cresco has launched the industry’s first national comprehensive Social Equity and Educational Development (SEED) initiative designed to ensure that all members of society have the skills, knowledge and opportunity to work in and own businesses in the cannabis industry. 

MISSION STATEMENT

At Cresco, we aim to lead the nation’s cannabis industry with a focus on regulatory compliance, product consistency, and customer satisfaction. Our operations bring legitimacy to the cannabis industry by acting with the highest level of integrity, strictly adhering to regulations, and promoting the clinical efficacy of cannabis. As Cresco grows, we will operate with the same level of professionalism and precision in each new market we move in to.

JOB SUMMARY

As a Product Manager  - Financial Systems in Finance and Accounting you will be responsible for liaising between IT and the Finance and Accounting organization to:

  • Be the voice of stakeholders, representing their needs of the IT applications that support business functions.
  • Establishing system requirements to support policies and SOPs, ensuring aligned strategic oversight of the Finance and Accounting IT applications, and actively monitoring maturing Cresco processes for compliance with SOX and GAAP.
  • Actively participating in product planning through visioning, road mapping, release planning, and approving product completeness.

Candidates should have a strong working knowledge of multi-platform technical environments as well as the ability to straddle the business & technology paradigm.  Yours is a blended role of business, finance, technology, and project management to drive system improvements and maturity.

CORE JOB DUTIES 

  • Ability to translate, validate, and communicate financial acumen into technical software solutions and enterprise architecture.
  • Ability to develop and streamline financial processes and applications.
  • With input from Finance and Accounting business users, contribute to the vision of the roadmaps for multiple internal applications and lead in backlog refinement and release planning preparation.
  • Contribute to a cross-functional team by gathering business requirements and breaking them down into user stories for IT developers and QA to consume and implement.
  • Prepare supporting artifacts such as process flow diagrams, wireframes, and report mockups.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and analysis of bottleneck issues to determine a resolution and translate into actionable items.
  • Support QA and UAT validation as needed to ensure the end solution meets the acceptance criteria, and fits into the overall enterprise architecture.
  • Perform application feature demos as needed.
  • Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the program lifecycle, refine details and work efficiently to remove roadblocks, as needed.
  • Demonstrate an aptitude to quickly learn business processes.
  • Demonstrate ability to develop strong relationships with key business and IT resources.
  • Prepare training plans, release notes, announcements, and other internal job aids to facilitate successful adoption of new features and functionality or obsolescence and removal of duplication. (Work with the Finance & Accounting function to remove obsolescence and duplication.)

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, EDUCATION AND SKILLS  

  • Degree(s) in technology related fields and Finance and Accounting (finding the blend between the disciplines – understand value of core/clean data). Masters level preferred.
  • PMP, TOGAF, or ITIL Certification(s) a plus.
  • 7 years’ experience working with financial systems and enterprise architecture with at least 2 years in a scrum/agile environment
  • 2 years of experience - strong leadership and PM skills, to organize, and orchestrate change in a start-up culture.
  • Professional Judgment - makes logical, rational, and integrative decisions, and arrives at sound conclusions. Chooses the best alternative(s) based on a review of pros, cons, tradeoffs, timing, and probabilities. Evaluates the consequences and implications of alternatives, actions, or decisions.
  • Makes timely decisions, balancing analysis with decisiveness.
  • Hands-on experience in gathering business requirements, often nebulous, and breaking down into consumable use cases.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize needs of the program.
  • Ability to work with minimal direction while being proactive and keeping leadership informed of project statuses and related issues.
  • Excelled skills with meeting facilitation, relationship management, leadership, critical thinking, technical writing, and presentation skills.
  • Strong interpersonal skills necessary to interact effectively with all levels of the business, vendors, and all levels of cross-functional teams and management in a highly dynamic and demanding work environment.
  • Self-motivated willingness to learn and self-teach.
  • Strong analytic and quantitative skills; ability to determine trends and propose solutions.
  • Proven problem-solving skills for troubleshooting and performing root cause analysis.

BENEFITS

Cresco Labs is proud to offer eligible employees a robust offering of benefits including, major medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(K)-match program, FSA/HSA programs, LTD/STD options, life insurance and AD&D.  We also offer eligible employees paid holidays and paid time off.  Other rewards may include annual discretionary bonuses, stock options as well as participation in our employee discount program. Benefits eligibility for permanent positions may vary by full-time or part-time roles, location, or position.

COMPENSATION

In accordance with CO Equal Pay for Equal Work Act the estimated range of compensation is  $110,000 - $130,000 + bonus eligible. Final offer details are determined by multiple factors including but not limited to, geographic location, market compensation data, skills, experience and other relevant factors. For questions about this please discuss with your recruiter during the interview process.

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS

  • Must be 21 years of age or older to apply
  • Must comply with all legal or company regulations for working in the industry 

Cresco Labs is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all applicants will be considered without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

results.title: Senior Marketing Manager, ABM
results.description:
About Census 🔁

Census is how data teams at companies like Figma, Notion, Rippling, Clearbit, and Fivetran build better business operations.

With Census, analysts can turn their data warehouse into a single source of truth and publish their insights directly into the apps that marketing, sales, and success teams use daily. With richer customer data, these teams can build better campaigns, understand what users are doing, and ultimately drive more sustainable revenue.

Backed by a16z and Sequoia, we're a hybrid team headquartered in San Francisco who love taking annoying problems most people avoid and building elegant solutions for them. We believe that data should be used for more than just making charts. This is why we built the first integration platform that works directly within cloud data warehouses.

This is an opportunity for an entrepreneurial marketer to shape the future data SaaS landscape.

You will reshape the world for target prospects. Through empathy, education, savvy positioning, and a little hustle, you’ll compel prospects to change how they see the world and motivate them to act.

You will be the leading edge. You’ll discover ways to reach and activate prospects. You’ll work hand in hand with business development and sales teams to validate your strategies and worth with growth and ops to scale these strategies.

You’ll have a direct impact. You will find success in creating real sales opportunities and your work will contribute directly to Census’ growth trajectory. The best part: you’ll have the resources, the organizational support, and the product offering to make it happen.

You will help Census grow. As a member of a collaborative organization, you will contribute to our collective knowledge and our bottom line. You will help deepen our understanding of our current and future customers and have the opportunity to learn from a range of teams and cultures. 


About you

You are a matchmaker. You have a sharp instinct for identifying unspoken needs and designing the propositions to address them. 

You are results-driven. The latest ABM targeting technology or Dungeons and Dragons and Data event invite? Yes. If it drives demand, it’s on the table. 

You are a strategic thinker. You see the interconnectivity in every touchpoint in the customer journey and you know how to orchestrate multi-channel, multi-touch ad campaigns. 

You move quickly. You know when speed beats perfection and that perfection is reached through iteration. You have the tact to unblock yourself and the will to drive action.

You are collaborative. You’ll partner with growth, ABM, content, events, sales, BD, and ops to transform strategies into results. You’ll educate the broader organization on what works and most importantly, why it works.

You are customer-centric to the core. You are not afraid to explore your audience’s ecosystem and engage with them through conversations online and in person. 

Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement 1:1 and 1:few ABM programs and initiatives that achieve quarterly goals.

results.title: Manager, Technical Accounting and Financial Reporting
results.description:
A home is the biggest investment most people make, and yet, it doesn’t come with a manual. That's why we’re building the only app homeowners need to effortlessly manage their homes —  knowing what to do, when to do it, and who to hire. With Thumbtack, millions of people care for what matters most, and pros earn billions of dollars through our platform. And as one of the fastest-growing companies in a $500B industry — we must be doing something right. 

We are driven by a common goal and the deep satisfaction that comes from knowing our work supports local economies, helps small businesses grow, and brings homeowners peace of mind. We’re seeking people who continually put our purpose first: advocating for pros and customers, embracing change, and choosing teamwork every day.

At Thumbtack, we're creating a new era of home care. If making an impact and the chance to do good inspires you, join us. Imagine what we’ll build together. 

Thumbtack by the Numbers

  • Available nationwide in all 3,143 U.S. counties
  • 70 million projects started on Thumbtack
  • More than 4 million customers in the last 12 months
  • Pros earn billions on our platform
  • More than 8 million 5-star reviews for our stellar pros 
  • 1000+ employees and $3.2 billion valuation (June, 2021)

About the Technical Accounting and Financial Reporting Team

The Technical Accounting and Financial Reporting Team is responsible for all things related to financial reporting and technical accounting for the Company and is involved in all aspects of the business, ensuring that we properly account for significant and complex transactions, track and implement new accounting pronouncements, develop and document accounting policies, prepare all U.S. GAAP financials and disclosures, and implement new systems and processes to enhance the Company’s financial reporting function. 

About the Role

As the Technical Accounting and Financial Reporting Manager you’ll have the exciting opportunity to work closely with all members of the Global Thumbtack Accounting team to implement policies and procedures, analyze complex deals, draft financial statements and help further build out the Company’s technical accounting and financial reporting function. Whether it's reporting on our financials, researching accounting literature, preparing a technical accounting memo, or answering questions on the application of Thumbtack's accounting policy, you will be a go-to resource for answering the "why" of Thumbtack's accounting positions. You’ll get to make a huge impact on implementing new systems and processes and further putting in place controls to aid the Company in maturing. 

Responsibilities

  • Preparation and review of the accounting and disclosures for the Company's annual and interim financials and support quarterly/yearly audits 
  • Evaluation of the accounting treatment for all significant accounting transactions, monitor, research and implement relevant accounting standards, and draft technical accounting memorandums on significant and complex transactions to support accounting positions
  • Review of contracts to identify technical accounting matters and ensure compliance with corporate and accounting policies
  • Working cross-functionally within the organization to support various stakeholders on technical accounting and financial reporting matters, including but not limited to other Controllership functions, Financial Planning and Analysis and others, as well as owning these cross-function relationships in order to manage impacts of such matters across the organization
  • Implementing new process and system improvements
  • Performing internal controls in compliance with SOX related to reporting and other complex technical accounting areas
  • Assisting with other duties and ad-hoc projects

What you'll need

If you don't think you meet all of the criteria below but still are interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team.

  • 6+ years of experience in accounting, including Big 4 accounting firm experience
  • CPA license
  • Public Accounting experience
  • Experience within a public company environment in internal controls,  technical accounting and SEC reporting
  • Excellent communication (written and verbal), organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Self-motivated- able to think independently, creatively, and opportunistically, a builders mindset
  • Proven ability to collaborate cross functionally

Bonus points if you have

  • Experience with NetSuite is a plus
  • Experience with ASC 842, ASC 350, ASC 718, and ASC 230 is a plus
  • Experience working for a tech company and building out processes across the Company
  • Public Accounting experience at one of the Big 4 firm

Thumbtack is a virtual-first company, meaning you can live and work from any one of our approved locations across the United States, Canada or the Philippines.* Learn more about our virtual-first working model here. #LI-Remote

Benefits & Perks
  • Virtual-first working model coupled with quarterly in-person events and Camp Thumbtack
  • 20+ company-wide holidays including two week-long shutdowns 
  • Libraries (collaborative workspaces) in San Francisco, Toronto, and Manila 
  • Stipends for remote work support, home office set-up and Thumbtack services
  • Cell phone and WiFi reimbursements 
  • Subscriptions and Employee Assistance Program for mental health and well-being 

Learn More About Us

  • Life @ Thumbtack Blog   
  • How Thumbtack is embracing virtual work  
  • Follow us on LinkedIn  
  • Meet the pros who inspire us

Thumbtack embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, state, or local law. We also will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, consistent with applicable law. 

Thumbtack is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation for a medical condition or disability during any part of the application process, please contact: recruitingops@thumbtack.com. 

If you are a California resident, please review information regarding your rights under California privacy laws contained in Thumbtack’s Privacy policy available at https://www.thumbtack.com/privacy/ .

results.title: Staff Product Manager, Enterprise
results.description:
About Drift  

Drift is the Revenue Acceleration platform that uses Conversational Marketing and Conversational Sales to help companies grow revenue and increase customer lifetime value, faster.  

More than 50,000 businesses use Drift to align sales and marketing on a single platform to deliver a unified customer experience where people are free to have a conversation with a business at any time, on their terms

Drift has become one of the fastest growing SaaS companies of all-time and was named to the Forbes Cloud 100, LinkedIn Top 50 Startups, Entrepreneur's Top Company Cultures, Boston Business Journal's Best Places to Work, and SaaS Company of the Year by the NEVCA.

About the role 

Our product organization is built of many small, autonomous teams who each own a product or critical capability. The teams are organized within larger squads that focus on our key product areas: marketing, sales, and enterprise. 

As a Principal Product Manager you will lead product management for the crucial Enterprise product area. The teams in Enterprise deliver the advanced capabilities our largest customers demand, including sophisticated reporting and API access, deep integrations with our CRM and data partners, flexible user and team management, and more. You’ll be responsible for the product direction and adoption in your areas, and partner with engineering and design leaders to drive success across the Drift product. You will get in the weeds with the teams to make sure we’re building the right thing, while also stepping back and working with peers in product design and engineering leadership to ensure we have the systems, processes, and frameworks to execute consistently at scale.

You understand the challenges and opportunities of developing Enterprise products and can help our entire team embrace the learnings and principles you have developed in your career.

What you’ll be doing on the Product team at Drift:

  • You’ll spend a lot of your time talking to customers, understanding their problems, and validating that your teams’ solutions solve a real problem for them.
  • You’ll join pre and post sales calls with enterprise customers, understand their needs, and effectively translate that into missions for your teams.
  • You’ll know the market cold. You’ll be an expert on Enterprise MarTech via your own research but also work with industry analysts to help develop your POV.
  • You’ll work with product design leadership to draft early concepts to foster customer development and validation.
  • You’ll work with Product Marketing to position new product launches to generate awareness, demand, and revenue.
  • Your insights will influence the direction of the entire product, not only the teams who directly report to you.
  • You’ll mentor several product managers and/or product leads who may report to you, and help them to build great products and grow in their careers.
  • You’ll dig into the weeds and help your product teams to execute when needed.

 

About you and what type of skills you’ll need:

  • You have experience building products in B2B Enterprise SaaS for 3+ years, Marketing or Sales products a plus.
  • You have 4+ years of software product management experience. 
  • You have mentored a product management team and been involved in hiring. 
  • You are experienced in leading product strategy processes, conducting analyst briefs, contributing on enterprise sales calls, developing product roadmaps, and executing product development processes.
  • You are well versed in CRMs and MarTech data and can manage complex partner integrations.
  • You have excellent written and oral communication skills, including experience presenting to executive stakeholders, participating in the sales process, and handling sensitive customer escalations.
  • You’re dedicated to your craft and want to work amongst a team that will inspire you on a daily basis.
  • You are positive, creative, curious, and aren’t afraid to ask a lot of questions.
  • You are can take candid feedback well and are looking to grow your skill set
  • You constantly question the status quo and can pivot quickly when needed to create the biggest impact.
  • You are detail oriented and organized.

Drift is committed to being an equal opportunity employer. 

We know that applying for a new job can be intimidating. But guess what? At Drift, there is no such thing as a “ideal candidate.” We believe in the power of teamwork -- and in the desire to learn something new every day. We believe in hiring people, not just skills. Take it from our Cofounder. 

If this sounds like a company you would like to join and a role you would thrive in, please don’t hold back from applying! Whatever skills you bring to the table or background you’re coming from, we welcome you to start a conversation with us. We need your unique perspective for our continued innovation and success. We’re looking forward to learning more about you!

Drift is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at disabilities@drift.com #LI-Remote #LI-BK

In service of various states’ wage disclosure laws: The base salary range for this role’s listed level is currently $185-224k for US candidates. Through a review of equity with other team members, market data, experience, knowledge, skills and the abilities of the applicant, the level and salary ranges may change.

results.title: Proposal & Communications Manager
results.description:
Come join our Growth team! 

 

The Opportunity

A growing company of less than 50,  you will join an ambitious team of builders -- across engineering, growth, product, and data -- all focused on using technology to improve the lives and outcomes for people going through career transitions. We bring innovation, creativity, and empathy to our work, and care deeply about the impact our technology can have on our customers and users.

 

We are looking to hire a Proposal & Communications Manager to own the end-to-end process for both FutureFit AI’s responses to RFP’s and our overall external communications.

 

As our Proposal & Communications Manager, you will lead all aspects of written content and project management for FutureFit AI’s responses to strategic opportunities, including requests for proposals (RFPs). You will also have the opportunity to own our overall communications efforts (e.g., copywriting for newsletter, messaging on websites / social media, press releases, case studies, etc.) to help FutureFit AI distill and communicate our brand identity and impact externally.

 

How You’ll Fulfill Your Mission

  • Create winning proposals for FutureFit AI solutions that address prospective partners’ requirements while highlighting FutureFit AI’s experience and unique advantages.

  • Manage overall RFP activities (e.g., initial requirements mapping,  stakeholder management, drafting, editing, reviewing, etc.) to ensure a best-in-class and on-time submission. 

  • Develop and manage project plans (timelines, milestones, dependencies, deliverables) for specific proposal and communications projects.

  • Build and maintain strong partnerships with both internal team members and FutureFit AI’s external partners to better develop, coordinate, direct, and facilitate strategic communications designed to meet business goals.

  • Research and understand key business challenges, customer behaviors, target audiences, competitive dynamics, and environmental factors to help develop relevant and valuable written content

  • Document and share results and best practices with internal stakeholders, and help ensure consistency in style across all written content.

 

Why We Value You

We strongly believe that the quality of talent is best measured by motivation, alignment of purpose, skills, depth of experiences, and learning agility. While your past learning and work experiences help us understand who you are, what has shaped you, and what you have been exposed to, we do not use minimum education or years of experience requirements in our job postings.

  • Experienced. You should bring relevant work experience in proposal writing, communications, and/or research. Specific experience in spaces such as workforce development, economic development, education, technology, or public sector is a plus.

  • Written Communication. You have stellar narrative writing  and editing skills, and are also able to respond to highly technical requirements.

  • Creative Execution: You know how to develop content and direct creative execution to provide a consistent, targeted, and impactful message.

  • Collaborative. You are able to own end-to-end processes, pulling in the right people and expertise at the right time and collaborating with FutureFit AI partner stakeholders where applicable.

  • Project Management. You bring strong project management and multi-tasking skills, as well as the ability to work effectively in situations requiring adherence to tight deadlines.

  • Agile. You are comfortable navigating ambiguity and working with many competing priorities. You maintain composure and remain positive and strategic under pressure.

  • Detail-Oriented. You obsess over small details that you know can have a huge impact on the success of the projects you lead.

  • Passionate. You are passionate about using technology to improve the lives and outcomes for people going through career transitions.

 

Location: There is a preference (but not requirement) for this role to be based in New York City, but applications will be considered from anywhere in the US or Canada.

Compensation: $70,000 to $120,000 based on applied experience, geographic location, and other factors identified by the hiring committee.

 

Benefits: We provide a generous benefits package to all of our team members, including unlimited PTO, health care, technology reimbursement, and flexible schedules.

 

About FutureFit AI 

FutureFit AI believes that the greatest challenge of the Future of Work is facilitating successful career transitions, and our mission is to address that challenge by using AI to transform the education and economic mobility of 100 million people in the next 10 years. 

FutureFit AI is a growing, well-funded, company focused on using technology to improve the lives and outcomes for people going through career transitions. We bring innovation, creativity, and empathy to our work, and care deeply about the impact our technology can have on our customers and users.

 

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.


© FutureFit AI All rights reserved, we are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We encourage people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives to apply.

results.title: Partnerships Specialist
results.description:
Do you want to contribute to solving one of the most important issues of our generation? Join us in accelerating the transition to a water secure world.

 

Waterplan is a fast-growing startup in the Climate Tech space that develops the world’s leading B2B Enterprise SaaS platform for companies to measure, respond, report, and monitor companies´ increasingly changing water risk. You can find more info by watching this World Economic Forum post.

 

By showing companies the business case for mitigating water risk, Waterplan accelerates the transition to a world where companies are incentivized to save more water, abate the discharge of polluting effluents, conserve watersheds and preserve shared value.

 

Due to continued growth, we are looking for a Partnership Specialist to join the Customer Success Team at Waterplan.

 

You will work in a fully remote distributed team across multiple disciplines at a science-oriented company, in the Partnership’s team which is part of the strategic growth for the following years, and is at the center of clients’ water offsets and environmental impact.

 

At Waterplan, you will have the chance to work at the forefront of our industry and with world-leading water and sustainability experts.

 

We are a dedicated and talented team with ambitious growth goals planned for the next few years. If you are interested in the Climate Tech space and in growing the Climate Water Resilience category, you have an entrepreneurial spirit and a lot of drive; we want to get to know you!

 

About your core focus

 

We are looking for early sales hires in LATAM who want to bring Waterplan to more organizations. Every year, 30% more companies launch and report climate water resilience programs globally (Source: CDP Water Security). Your mission will be to create and expand Waterplan’s network of partners in different parts of the globe and nurture existing ones. You will build long-term customer relationships with local and global organizations that aim to deploy water management and conservation projects and are looking for funding sources which Waterplan’s clients are able to provide. 

 

You will:

  • Sell Waterplan. Be proactively creative to find new global and local partner opportunities, expand Waterplan presence globally within these organizations, build long-term relationships and share how Waterplan can support their “water-positive” projects by raising funds through our marketplace and client base. Find new market segments for Waterplan’s Partnership team. 

  • Help write our partnership’s playbook and share market feedback with the Waterplan team. Inform Waterplan product strategy by sharing insights from partners on the front line. 

  • Lead your sessions with potential partners by being 100% owner and responsible of your targets, by meeting new leads and current clients.

  • Become a water expert and raise awareness around the fast-growing impact of solutions against the global water crisis.

 

Skills and Qualifications

  • Track record of outbound sales or roles with external stakeholder management (i.e. fundraising, customer success, consultancy, among others). + 3 years experience

  • You are a good listener and consultative seller, able to listen to and understand clients' challenges and help them achieve their goals. 

  • Excited about the early days of a startup, learning from customers, informing product strategy, refining the partnership’s playbook, and thinking of innovative ways to tell the Waterplan story. 

  • Skilled communicator. Passionate about the environment and water. 

  • A team player with experience selling products in complex and technical fields. Excited to learn about the environment and water and relentlessly curious. 

  • Have a track record of doing whatever it takes to get things done. You’ve accomplished something that others thought was impossible. You’re relentlessly resourceful.

  • Previous experience in the Climate Tech space is preferred (non-exclusive)

  • Fluence in written and oral English.

 

At Waterplan, you’ll enjoy

  • Our Mission. We are building something big, you will be part of an ambitious and impactful company, focused on achieving one of the major global sustainable development goals 

  • Our Spirit. We are creating something that has never been done before. The entrepreneurial spirit of our team is driving a profound transformation of the water sector

  • Our Team. Our team is our most valuable asset. Waterplanners bring together three worlds: technology, water and science. They are distributed all over the world, bringing their unique perspective to solve complex water resource challenges 

  • Our Values: Think Long Term, Iterative Excellence, Thoughtful Discussion, Make Others Successful.

results.title: Senior Security Engineer
results.description:
About You

You’re a software engineer with a deep security background, who loves autonomy and self-direction. You have experience coding in a variety of languages, as well as setting up SIEMs and other systems to monitor security-related events. You enjoy collaborating with others as well as working independently to accomplish your goals.

About the Job

You’ll join the distributed Constructor security team, which is responsible for both corporate and infrastructure security. You’ll be working with our CISO, our devops team, and our software engineers to create systems to monitor and improve security, help other engineers effectively write secure code, and test our systems to ensure they’re secure.

This role will have a large say in determining security priorities and enhancing Constructor’s security posture.

  • Working with other engineers to review code for vulnerabilities
  • Reviewing and improving our production security architecture

  • Have at least 5 years of experience working as a security professional
  • Have experience working with many programming languages, including Python, Ruby, and Javascript
  • Have experience setting up and maintaining security platforms, SIEMs, and monitoring systems
  • Have worked at a high-traffic website with highly available and robust systems
  • Pick up new ideas and technologies quickly, love learning and talking to others about them
  • Enjoy helping others around you
  • Can work independently

  • A competitive compensation package including stock options

results.title: Technical Product Owner
results.description:
At FORM we aim to build the world's first fully-integrated task management and image recognition platform for smarter retail execution. Our solution leverages machine learning to provide data and analyses about products and prices on physical shop shelves - in real-time. We are ambitious, we are striving for success, we create amazing things!



Your tasks will be:
  • Working closely with our largest and most strategic global customers, including emphasized involvement with one of our key enterprise accounts in the alcohol/beverage vertical. 
  • Translating our customer’s business needs to technical requirements.
  • Facilitating meetings with the engineering team.
  • Cooperating with senior Product Owners and Product Managers.
  • Ensuring that the backlog is always stack-ranked and groomed based on shifting priorities.



You have:
  • 2+ years of experience as a software Product Owner,
  • Knowledge of scaled agile frameworks,
  • Experience in facilitating productive technical discussions,
  • Experience in working with an engineering teams,
  • Eagerness to own a backlog and wear the hat of “scrum master” and “agile coach” when necessary,
  • A natural tendency to under promise and overdeliver, and not the other way around, 
  • Confidence in your technical understanding,
  • Comfortable using software tools such as JIRA, Figma, Lucidchart,
  • Knowledge about any programming language and SQL,
  • Excellent communication skills,
  • Proficient level of English and Polish, both spoken and written



Nice-to-haves:
  • Knowledge of machine learning models,
  • Knowledge of relational and document data stores, microservice architecture and RESTful APIs.
 



Our offer:
  • 12,000 - 21,000 PLN net (B2B) with paid days off, or 11,000-17,000 gross (UoP), depending on experience.
  • Working in a project using world-leading AI for product and price recognition.
  • Being part of a global team at a well-established, stable and rapidly growing business.
  • A startup atmosphere where you can feel the impact and importance of your work.
  • Very open lines of communication, expected both ways.
Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that those in underrepresented groups, such as women and those in our BIPOC communities, tend to not apply to jobs unless they meet every single requirement and qualification.  At FORM, we are dedicated to building diverse, inclusive, and an authentic workplace-- So, if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway.  You may be the right candidate for this or other roles at FORM!
 
About FORM
FORM powers the world’s 2 billion mobile workers as they change companies and industries for good, with mobile technology that improves execution from the frontline. FORM activates and connects teams in the field – with leaders, missions, and each other – so they can deliver success in the enterprise. The FORM field execution platform serves as a digital assistant for frontline teams by guiding daily tasks, streamlining data collection, facilitating real-time communication, and providing leaders with real-time intelligence to drive faster actions and better decisions. FORM offers the world’s only integrated task management and image recognition platform and enables smart audits on more display types than any solution in the market, plus industry-leading field communications and photo reporting capabilities. FORM solutions have been deployed by Fortune 500 companies around the world. 
 
OUR SOLUTIONS:
 
FORM OpX
FORM OpX empowers teams to improve operational compliance by digitizing audits and inspections to reduce risk and improve safety and quality from the frontline. FORM OpX mobile workflows make it easy to capture the right data, at the right place, at the right time – every time. Teams stay connected with instant frontline communications on mobile, and real-time insights allow leaders to spot and fix issues quickly and measure trends over time so teams can take action on the opportunities that move the business forward.
 
FORM MarketX
FORM MarketX unleashes the power of field teams to drive market execution with the only mobile solution that combines dynamic task management, industry-leading image recognition, photo reporting, field team communications, and advanced reporting – all within one easy-to-use platform. Guide teams, improve execution, and drive sales while creating a shared view of the field that helps leaders make better decisions, faster. Sell more with FORM MarketX, the field execution app that guides, tracks, and improves performance in real-time. 
 
Who We Are
We are innovators: We’re here to free mobile workers from the mundane and open up new worlds of possibility and prosperity, powered by the people.

Humble + hungry. We measure success by how we help customers win. And we've been in the game a long time (in software years). Every interaction gives us the chance to deliver better service and more value. Along the way we've picked up a few awards, and for that, we're thankful.

results.title: Junior Recruiter/Talent Acquisition
results.description:
After another very exciting year of rapid growth, FXC Intelligence are looking to add a Junior Recruiter to their growing Talent Acquisition team. This is going to be the business’ second Talent Acquisition hire and it would be an ideal fit for someone who is at the start of their recruitment career and is looking to develop their skills in an in-house recruitment setting.

We are a fast growing fintech company providing financial data to an enterprise client list of household brands, which include HSBC, PayPal, World Bank, Western Union and MasterCard among others. We are rapidly building on our already strong reputation in the finance sector, and as a result, most of our recent clients have been gained through word of mouth. We can also boast an almost 100% repeat business rate, both of which are incredible achievements for a start-up company.

The role:

Part of the wider People Team, the Junior Recruiter will support in recruiting for various roles across the business but also with wider initiatives across the People Team. The role will entail candidate sourcing and screening; posting job adverts and arranging interviews; and managing the ATS database. This is in addition to administrative tasks and the occasional support on projects such as D&I, Onboarding and Employee Engagement.

Necessary skills and experience:

  • Recruitment experience in an agency or in-house setting, gained with the technology or data sector

  • A strong work ethic and a can-do attitude

  • Ability to take ownership and work without extensive supervision

  • Passionate about delivering an immaculate candidate experience

  • Resilient nature and ability to push through adversity

  • Organisation and good attention to detail

 

Nice-to-have skills:

  • Experience using an ATS (we currently use Teamtailor)

  • Experience using job boards and linkedin recruiter to source candidates

  • Ability to write compelling job descriptions

  • Interest in the fintech sector

 

Why you should consider this role:

  • FXC Intelligence is in a very strong position and will continue to grow throughout 2023, despite the prospects of a recession and economic instability in the wider market

  • You will be part of a great team of genuine people who are fun to work with but also extremely driven

  • As the business and the team is still relatively small and growing, your contribution will make a very significant impact and you will have a lot of opportunities to grow and develop

  • You will have autonomy and the ability to make the role your own

 

What we offer:

  • Up to £30,000 + up to 20% annual bonus/option scheme

  • 25 days holiday per annum

  • Healthcare for you and your family

  • 5% pension

  • Enhanced maternity and paternity policy

  • Monthly socials

  • Quarterly external one-to-one coaching sessions

  • A supportive, collaborative environment with plenty of opportunities to learn

  • A chance to work with a vibrant, friendly team with a relaxed but committed culture

  • Flexible working culture – we can offer remote working

 

We’re an innovative company that knows how to look after its employees and we take pride in providing a flexible working environment, a great company culture and great opportunities for career growth. Have a look at our careers page to find out more about our perks and benefits and to see for yourself what it’s like to work with us: https://careers.fxcintel.com/

Also, why not take a look at our employee engagement blog to see how our colleagues feel about working at FXC Intelligence: https://careers.fxcintel.com/blog/posts/60820-what-do-our-employees-think-of-fxc-intelligence

At FXC Intelligence, we believe in embracing diversity in all of its forms and fostering an inclusive environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.

results.title: Director of Product Management
results.description:
Who we are

Sensible is built to help consumers and businesses understand, plan for, and mitigate all types of climate and weather risk. We work at the intersection of deep technology, science and experience design. Our first product embeds with travel and outdoor events partners, offering their customers a guarantee against bad weather. This means a customer can have confidence that they will have a great time in the sun. If not, they get their money back!

We recognize that we're living in a world with more climate disruption than ever before. We also believe that it is one of unprecedented opportunity for solutions.

With rich data from satellites and other developing technologies, we have the right information, engineering, and technology to help us relate to our environment with a new kind of awareness and understanding.

Sensible is a team built on trust, feedback, and communication. We recognize that diversity of background, skills, and experiences makes stronger teams. We are, therefore, an equal opportunity employer.

What You'll Be Doing

As the Director of Product Management you will be responsible for building a high performing product management team that works cross-functionally to deliver value for our users, both consumers and our travel partners. You will be responsible for ensuring aligned incentives across pods, providing context and direction to teams, hiring and managing product managers, and thinking strategically about how our teams and products scale.

We are a highly cross-functional team where individual pods are given a lot of freedom to own their strategy and roadmap. You are the kind of leader that loves empowering people on your team to find success while equipping them with the skills and context they need. You will collaborate with leaders from design, engineering, and business functions to ensure teams have the resources they need and that Sensible continues to have a unified vision and direction that everyone believes in.

We are B2B2C business where our product development team comes from a blend of consumer products and SaaS/platform experience. We care deeply about design thinking and end-user experience.


Requirements
  • 10+ years of leading product development, experience in fintech or travel tech is a plus
  • 4+ years of experience managing product managers or similar roles
  • Experience with teams and products at scale
  • Technical proficiency in working with engineering concepts and architecture
  • Appreciation and understanding of what quality UX means and how products get there
  • The ability to combined the qualitative with the quantitative to manage ambiguity
  • A high level of comfort with actively sharing information and story telling across an organization
  • A strategic mindset

results.title: Sr. Product Manager
results.description:
Hive is an email marketing CRM used by brands to personalize and automate their marketing. We pride ourselves on helping brands keep their customers engaged, sell more, and continually improve their marketing.

We integrate with partners like Shopify and Ticketmaster to let brands act on their customer data in real-time, so they can easily segment customers and send perfectly targeted and customized emails & SMS.

We started our company in a University of Waterloo computer lab in early 2014, graduated from Y Combinator that summer (S14 batch) and have been growing ever since. You’ll join our team in Canada (hive.co/careers).

We’re looking for a passionate Product Manager to work alongside our engineering team to ensure we’re making good decisions and building as effectively as possible - while coordinating with other teams at Hive to communicate what/why we’re building (and not building) and the value it will bring to our customers.

You’ll be the first hire on the Product team and will get to dictate the tools we use, the systems we build and the processes that we follow.

What You’ll Do:

  • Own the roadmap - helping us drive as much impact as possible each development cycle, and find a home for valuable ideas that we’re not ready to build yet

  • Talk to customers, understand their problems, and translate these into opportunities for the business

  • Articulate your hypotheses clearly, validate them early and repeatedly, and know when to prototype, gather more data, or start fresh

  • Work with our developers to translate incoming items on the roadmap into clearly specced out tasks to be built

  • Help the team understand why we make the decisions we make, and how the product we ship will impact our customers

  • Work with marketing and CX to drive feature adoption

  • Work with sales and partnerships to ensure we’re leveraging product to drive new business

Who you are:

  • 5 + years of product experience at a software company - bonus points for SaaS or martech experience

  • Strong design skills and familiarity with at least 1 common design tool (we prefer Figma)

  • Familiarity with coding - you don’t need to be a CS major, but you should have a strong enough technical background to navigate your way through the more complex requirements of our product and infrastructure

  • Strong data analytics skills (SQL skills a bonus) and the ability to formulate analyses to answer key product questions

  • An insistence to work in a fast-paced, iterative environment

  • Excellent communication skills, paired with resourcefulness and the ability to act autonomously

  • Business sense - you can constantly spot and contrast various approaches to building the business, and enjoy assessing tradeoffs to make decisions

Bottom line... We're looking for curious, hardworking, down-to-earth people - who are passionate about product.

 

Comp/Benefits Package

  • Meaningful salary and equity: you're rewarded based on impact

  • Work fully remote in Canada: wherever you're happiest & productive

  • Flexible work hours: miminal meetings and no 9-5

  • Health & Dental coverage

  • Unlimited vacation/PTO: so you can be happy and healthy!

  • Comp Range $90-120k per year

     

To learn more about our team check out our About Us page on our website: https://www.hive.co/company
